edu.isr.data

Class ParametersManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.isr.data.ParametersManager

  • public class ParametersManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Responsible for parsing command line arguments and setting up the parameters necessary for running the experiment.

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • ParametersManager

        public ParametersManager()
        Create a new ParametersManager and set the command line options.

    • Method Detail

      • setOptions

        private void setOptions()
        Set the command line options. There are two options: -p: The path for the parameter file (mandatory). -h: A flag indicating that the program should create a parameter file model (optional).

      • parseCommandLine

        public void parseCommandLine(java.lang.String[] args)
                      throws java.io.IOException,
                             org.apache.commons.cli.ParseException
        Parse the command line arguments.
        Parameters:
        args - Command line arguments.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If a required argument is not present or if some error occurs while creating the model file.
        org.apache.commons.cli.ParseException - If an error is reached while parsing the command line.

      • setParameters

        public void setParameters()
                   throws java.io.IOException,
                          org.apache.commons.cli.MissingOptionException,
                          java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Load and set all the parameters necessary for running the experiment.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If some error occurs while reading any of the parameter files.
        org.apache.commons.cli.MissingOptionException - If a required parameter was not found in any of the parameter files.
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - If a parameter that is supposed to be integer is actually a string.

      • loadParameterFile

        private java.util.Properties loadParameterFile(java.lang.String parameterFilePath)
                                        throws java.io.IOException
        Load all the parameters.
        Parameters:
        parameterFilePath - Path to the child parameter file.
        Returns:
        A set of properties containing all the loaded parameters.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If some error occurs while reading any of the parameter files.

      • writeParameterFileModel

        private void writeParameterFileModel()
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Create a file with the name and description of all parameters.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If some error occurs while creating the model file.

      • assignParameters

        private void assignParameters()
                       throws org.apache.commons.cli.MissingOptionException
        Assign the loaded parameter to the corresponding variables.
        Throws:
        org.apache.commons.cli.MissingOptionException - If a required parameter is not found in any of the parameter files.
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - If a parameter that is supposed to be integer is actually a string.

      • getIntegerParameter

        private int getIntegerParameter(ParametersManager.ParameterList key)
                         throws org.apache.commons.cli.MissingOptionException,
                                java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Load an integer parameter from the parameter file.
        Parameters:
        key - The name of the parameter.
        Returns:
        The parameter loaded from the parameter file.
        Throws:
        org.apache.commons.cli.MissingOptionException - If the parameter is mandatory and is not present in any of the parameter files.
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - If the loaded value is actually a string.

      • getDoubleParameter

        private double getDoubleParameter(ParametersManager.ParameterList key)
                           throws org.apache.commons.cli.MissingOptionException
        Load an double parameter from the parameter file.
        Parameters:
        key - The name of the parameter.
        Returns:
        The parameter loaded from the parameter file.
        Throws:
        org.apache.commons.cli.MissingOptionException - If the parameter is mandatory and is not present in any of the parameter files.
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - If the loaded value is actually a string.

      • getStringParameter

        private java.lang.String getStringParameter(ParametersManager.ParameterList key,
                                            boolean isFile)
                                     throws org.apache.commons.cli.MissingOptionException
        Load a string parameter from the parameter file.
        Parameters:
        key - The name of the parameter.
        isFile - Flag indicating if the string describes a file path.
        Returns:
        The parameter loaded from the parameter file.
        Throws:
        org.apache.commons.cli.MissingOptionException - If the parameter is mandatory and is not present in any of the parameter files.

      • getLoadedParametersLog

        java.lang.StringBuilder getLoadedParametersLog()
        Return a log with parameter values. Useful for keeping track of the parameters used in the experiment.
        Returns:
        A structured string containing the name and description of all parameters.

      • getOrigPath

        public java.lang.String getOrigPath()
        After the execution of the weighting step, each instance has a rank. The construction of this rank is based on the folds created after the embedding generation step. The selection, however, is made over the original folds, which the path is stored by the variable origPath.
        Returns:
        The path to the folder containing the original folds.

      • getInPath

        public java.lang.String getInPath()
        Return the path to the folder containing the input folds (created during the embedding generation step) that should be used as input in the experiment. At first, these files will be training sets only, since the ISR algorithm is currently applied as an pre-processing step. Test sets will not be read.
        Returns:
        The input path.

      • getOutPath

        public java.lang.String getOutPath()
        Return the path where the output files should be saved.
        Returns:
        The output path.

      • getDatasetName

        public java.lang.String getDatasetName()
        Return the name of the dataset used in the experiment.
        Returns:
        The dataset name.

      • getScheme

        public java.lang.String getScheme()
        Return the scheme that will be used in order to weigh the instances. Three schemes were implemented: proximity, surrounding, and remoteness (which combines the first two). There is also a random scheme, which can be used for validation purposes.
        Returns:
        The weighting scheme.

      • getSelectionLevel

        public java.lang.String getSelectionLevel()
        Return an identifier that indicates the percentage of instances that should be removed. This identifier needs to be parsed to a numeric value before being used.
        Returns:
        The selection level.

      • getDistMetric

        public double getDistMetric()
        Return the metric used in order to calculate distances between instances. Two metrics were implemented: Euclidean and fractional.
        Returns:
        The distance metric.

      • getNumNeighbors

        public int getNumNeighbors()
        Return the number of instances taken as neighbors when applying methods that depend on the notion of closeness.
        Returns:
        The number of neighbors.
